wiki.content: According to Runaway Songfacts, West debuted this song on September 12, 2010 at the 2010 MTV Video Music Awards. He said the song was about having remorse for being a fool then rapped about toasting those who are douche-bags, scumbags and jerk-offs. Afterwards the Chicago MC dedicated his performance to his late mother. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: According to Runaway Songfacts, West debuted this song on September 12, 2010 at the 2010 MTV Video Music Awards. He said the song was about having remorse for being a fool then rapped about toasting those who are douche-bags, scumbags and jerk-offs. Afterwards the Chicago MC dedicated his performance to his late mother.

track.name: Runaway (feat. Pusha T)
comments: Some of the worst vocals I've ever heard. I must admit though, I kind of like the message and lyrics.

the best song of all time
that 3 minute vocoder outro just puts me in awe
kanye is one motherfuckin genius fo sure.
Is that Kanye West singing on this song?
six minutes of heaven, three minutes of hell
MBDTF's finest moment, and its only one to remember.
